maml:description.maml:para: Gives permissions to a specified user to access a Power BI workspace.

Grants permissions to a specified user to access a Power BI workspace using the provided inputs and scope specified. Before you run this command, make sure you log in using Connect-PowerBIServiceAccount.

maml:Description.maml:para: Permissions to assign to the user.
ID of the workspace the user should be added to.

Indicates scope of the call. Individual operates against only workspaces assigned to the caller; Organization operates against all workspaces within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.
User Principal Name (or UPN, commonly an email address) for the user whose permissions need to be added.
Permissions to assign to the user.
ID of the workspace the user should be added to.
Identifier of the principal to add to the group. For Apps and Groups, this will be their object identifier (GUID). For users, this can be an email address.
The type of the principal to add to the group.

Indicates scope of the call. Individual operates against only workspaces assigned to the caller; Organization operates against all workspaces within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.
Permissions to assign to the user.
Identifier of the principal to add to the group. For Apps and Groups, this will be their object identifier (GUID). For users, this can be an email address.
The type of the principal to add to the group.

Indicates scope of the call. Individual operates against only workspaces assigned to the caller; Organization operates against all workspaces within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.
The workspace entity to add the user to.
Permissions to assign to the user.

Indicates scope of the call. Individual operates against only workspaces assigned to the caller; Organization operates against all workspaces within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.
User Principal Name (or UPN, commonly an email address) for the user whose permissions need to be added.
The workspace entity to add the user to.
Permissions to assign to the user.
ID of the workspace the user should be added to.
Identifier of the principal to add to the group. For Apps and Groups, this will be their object identifier (GUID). For users, this can be an email address.
The type of the principal to add to the group.

Indicates scope of the call. Individual operates against only workspaces assigned to the caller; Organization operates against all workspaces within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.
User Principal Name (or UPN, commonly an email address) for the user whose permissions need to be added.
The workspace entity to add the user to.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Add-PowerBIWorkspaceUser -Scope Organization -Id 23FCBDBD-A979-45D8-B1C8-6D21E0F4BE50 -UserEmailAddress john@contoso.com -AccessRight Admin

maml:description.maml:para: Returns a list of Power BI workspaces.

Retrieves a list of Power BI workspaces that match the specified search criteria and scope. By default (without -First parameter) it shows the first 100 workspaces assigned to the user. Use -First and -Skip to fetch more workspaces or use -All to return all workspaces. Before you run this command, make sure you log in using Connect-PowerBIServiceAccount.

maml:Description.maml:para: Indicates to show all the workspaces. -First and -Skip cannot be used with this parameter.
Indicates to show only deleted workspaces. Only supported when -Scope Organization is specified.
OData filter, case-sensitive (element names start lowercase).
Retrieves related artifacts associated with the Power BI workspace. Only available when -Scope is Organization.
Indicates to show only orphaned workspaces. Only supported when -Scope Organization is specified.

Indicates scope of the call. Individual returns only workspaces assigned to the caller; Organization returns all workspaces within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.
Filter workspaces to show ones which the user is contained within. Only available when -Scope is Organization.
Indicates to show only deleted workspaces. Only supported when -Scope Organization is specified.
OData filter, case-sensitive (element names start lowercase).
First (top) list of results. This value defaults to 100.
Retrieves related artifacts associated with the Power BI workspace. Only available when -Scope is Organization.
Indicates to show only orphaned workspaces. Only supported when -Scope Organization is specified.

Indicates scope of the call. Individual returns only workspaces assigned to the caller; Organization returns all workspaces within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.
Skips the first set of results.
Filter workspaces to show ones which the user is contained within. Only available when -Scope is Organization.
ID of the workspace to return.
Retrieves related artifacts associated with the Power BI workspace. Only available when -Scope is Organization.

Indicates scope of the call. Individual returns only workspaces assigned to the caller; Organization returns all workspaces within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.
Retrieves related artifacts associated with the Power BI workspace. Only available when -Scope is Organization.
Name of the workspace to return if one exists with that name. Case insensitive search.

Indicates scope of the call. Individual returns only workspaces assigned to the caller; Organization returns all workspaces within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.
Indicates to show all the workspaces. -First and -Skip cannot be used with this parameter.
Indicates to show only deleted workspaces. Only supported when -Scope Organization is specified.
OData filter, case-sensitive (element names start lowercase).
First (top) list of results. This value defaults to 100.
ID of the workspace to return.
Retrieves related artifacts associated with the Power BI workspace. Only available when -Scope is Organization.
Name of the workspace to return if one exists with that name. Case insensitive search.
Indicates to show only orphaned workspaces. Only supported when -Scope Organization is specified.

Indicates scope of the call. Individual returns only workspaces assigned to the caller; Organization returns all workspaces within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.
Skips the first set of results.
Filter workspaces to show ones which the user is contained within. Only available when -Scope is Organization.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the first 100 Power BI workspaces the calling user is assigned to (-Scope Individual).
Returns all Power BI workspaces the calling user is assigned to.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-PowerBIWorkspace -Scope Organization -Filter "tolower(name) eq 'contoso sales'"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns a workspace named 'Contoso Sales' (case insensitive with tolower) within the user's organization.
Returns all Power BI workspaces along with related reports, dashboards, datasets, dataflows and workbooks within the user's organization.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets Power BI workspace migration status.
Gets Power BI workspace migration status.

maml:Description.maml:para: ID of the workspace.
The workspace entity.
ID of the workspace.
The workspace entity.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new Power BI workspace.
Creates a new Power BI workspace with the current user as the workspace administrator.

maml:Description.maml:para: The name to give to the new workspace. If the name matches another workspace in the organization, the operation will fail.
The name to give to the new workspace. If the name matches another workspace in the organization, the operation will fail.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new Power BI workspace called "New Workspace" and adds the current user as the workspace administrator.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes permissions to a Power BI workspace for the specified user.
Removes permissions for a specified user to a Power BI workspace using the provided inputs and scope specified. Before you run this command, make sure you log in using Connect-PowerBIServiceAccount.

maml:Description.maml:para: ID of the workspace the user should be removed from.

Indicates scope of the call. Individual operates against only workspaces assigned to the caller; Organization operates against all workspaces within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.
User Principal Name (or UPN, commonly an email address) for the user whose permissions need to be removed.

Indicates scope of the call. Individual operates against only workspaces assigned to the caller; Organization operates against all workspaces within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.
User Principal Name (or UPN, commonly an email address) for the user whose permissions need to be removed.
The workspace entity to remove the user from.
ID of the workspace the user should be removed from.

Indicates scope of the call. Individual operates against only workspaces assigned to the caller; Organization operates against all workspaces within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.
User Principal Name (or UPN, commonly an email address) for the user whose permissions need to be removed.
The workspace entity to remove the user from.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes permissions for user john@contoso.com on workspace with ID 23FCBDBD-A979-45D8-B1C8-6D21E0F4BE50 within the caller's organization.
Removes permissions for john@contoso.com on workspace with ID 23FCBDBD-A979-45D8-B1C8-6D21E0F4BE50, which is a workpace the caller owns.

maml:description.maml:para: Restores a deleted Power BI workspace.

Restores a deleted Power BI workspace with the owner set to the user that matches the specified email address. Only workspaces in the new workspace experiences preview are supported and only deleted workspaces that haven't reached the data retention policy to be completely removed. Only -Scope Organization is supported and you must have administrator rights (such as Office 365 Global Administrator or Power BI Service Administrator) to call this command. You must have logged in previously before using Connect-PowerBIServiceAccount.

maml:Description.maml:para: User Principal Name (or UPN, commonly an email address) of the user who will become the admin of the restored workspace.
ID of the workspace to restore.
An optional new name to give to the restored workspace.

Indicates scope of the call. Individual is not supported; Organization can restore any deleted workspaces within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate) unless the workspace met its data retention policy and completed removal. Organization is the default.
User Principal Name (or UPN, commonly an email address) of the user who will become the admin of the restored workspace.
An optional new name to give to the restored workspace.

Indicates scope of the call. Individual is not supported; Organization can restore any deleted workspaces within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate) unless the workspace met its data retention policy and completed removal. Organization is the default.
The workspace entity to be restored.
User Principal Name (or UPN, commonly an email address) of the user who will become the admin of the restored workspace.
ID of the workspace to restore.
An optional new name to give to the restored workspace.

Indicates scope of the call. Individual is not supported; Organization can restore any deleted workspaces within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate) unless the workspace met its data retention policy and completed removal. Organization is the default.
The workspace entity to be restored.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Restores the workspace with the specified ID, assigns the user with the specified email address as the admin, and updates the name of the workspace to the specified name.

maml:description.maml:para: Updates the name or description of a Power BI workspace. Only workspaces in the new workspace experiences preview are supported. Only -Scope Organization is supported and you must have administrator rights (such as Office 365 Global Administrator or Power BI Service Administrator) to call this command. Before you run this command, make sure you log in using Connect-PowerBIServiceAccount.

maml:Description.maml:para: The capacity object id which a workspace will be assigned to. If CapacityId is set to "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000", the workspace will be migrated to shared capacity.
ID of the workspace to update.

Indicates scope of the call. Only Organization is supported with this cmdlet. Organization operates against all workspaces within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.
The new description to give to the workspace to update.
ID of the workspace to update.
The new name to give to the workspace to update. If the name matches another workspace in the organization, the update operation will fail.

Indicates scope of the call. Only Organization is supported with this cmdlet. Organization operates against all workspaces within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.

Indicates scope of the call. Only Organization is supported with this cmdlet. Organization operates against all workspaces within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.
The workspace entity to update. The workspace will be updated with the name and description on the object.
The capacity object id which a workspace will be assigned to. If CapacityId is set to "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000", the workspace will be migrated to shared capacity.
The new description to give to the workspace to update.
ID of the workspace to update.
The new name to give to the workspace to update. If the name matches another workspace in the organization, the update operation will fail.

Indicates scope of the call. Only Organization is supported with this cmdlet. Organization operates against all workspaces within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.
The workspace entity to update. The workspace will be updated with the name and description on the object.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-PowerBIWorkspace -Scope Organization -Id "3244f1c1-01cf-457f-9383-6035e4950fdc" -Name "Test Name" -Description "Test Description"

dev:remarks.maml:para: If the current user is an administrator, this will update the workspace matching the specified ID with the specified name and description values for a workspace in the caller's organization.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $workspaces = Get-PowerBIWorkspace -Scope Organization PS C:\> $workspace = $workspaces[0] PS C:\> $workspace.Name = "Test Name" PS C:\> $workspace.Description = "Test Description" PS C:\> Set-PowerBIWorkspace -Scope Organization -Workspace $workspace

dev:remarks.maml:para: If the current user is an administrator, this will update the specified workspace object with the specified name and description values for a workspace in the caller's organization.
